intro: Pteleocarpa malaccensis, commonly known as the Malacca pteleocarpa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
